member.summary: Gets request headers needed process the handshake on the server.

member.summary: Validates the Sec-WebSocket-Key request header

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.WebSocketOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for the WebSocketMiddleware

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.WebSocketOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency at which to send Ping/Pong keep-alive control frames. The default is two minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.WebSocketOptions.ReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the protocol buffer used to receive and parse frames. The default is 4kb.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket
member.summary: A managed implementation of a web socket that sends and receives data via a .
member.remarks: Thread-safety: - It's acceptable to call ReceiveAsync and SendAsync in parallel. One of each may run concurrently. - It's acceptable to have a pending ReceiveAsync while CloseOutputAsync or CloseAsync is called. - Attemping to invoke any other operations in parallel may corrupt the instance. Attempting to invoke a send operation while another is in progress or a receive operation while another is in progress will result in an exception.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.CreateFromConnectedStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.ArraySegment{System.Byte}})
member.summary: Creates a from a connected to a websocket endpoint.
member.param: The connected Stream.
true if this is the server-side of the connection; false if this is the client-side of the connection.
The agreed upon subprotocol for the connection.
The interval to use for keep-alive pings.
The buffer size to use for received data.
Optional buffer to use for receives.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.t_headerMask
member.summary: Per-thread cached 4-byte mask byte array.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.s_random
member.summary: Thread-safe random number generator used to generate masks for each send.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.s_textEncoding
member.summary: Encoding for the payload of text messages: UTF8 encoding that throws if invalid bytes are discovered, per the RFC.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.s_validSendStates
member.summary: Valid states to be in when calling SendAsync.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.s_validReceiveStates
member.summary: Valid states to be in when calling ReceiveAsync.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.s_validCloseOutputStates
member.summary: Valid states to be in when calling CloseOutputAsync.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.s_validCloseStates
member.summary: Valid states to be in when calling CloseAsync.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.MaxMessageHeaderLength
member.summary: The maximum size in bytes of a message frame header that includes mask bytes.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.MaxControlPayloadLength
member.summary: The maximum size of a control message payload.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.MaskLength
member.summary: Length of the mask XOR'd with the payload data.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._stream
member.summary: The stream used to communicate with the remote server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._isServer
member.summary: true if this is the server-side of the connection; false if it's client. This impacts masking behavior: clients always mask payloads they send and expect to always receive unmasked payloads, whereas servers always send unmasked payloads and expect to always receive masked payloads.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._subprotocol
member.summary: The agreed upon subprotocol with the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._keepAliveTimer
member.summary: Timer used to send periodic pings to the server, at the interval specified

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._abortSource
member.summary: CancellationTokenSource used to abort all current and future operations when anything is canceled or any error occurs.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._receiveBuffer
member.summary: Buffer used for reading data from the network.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._receiveBufferFromPool
member.summary: Gets whether the receive buffer came from the ArrayPool.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._utf8TextState
member.summary: Tracks the state of the validity of the UTF8 encoding of text payloads. Text may be split across fragments.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._sendFrameAsyncLock
member.summary: Semaphore used to ensure that calls to SendFrameAsync don't run concurrently. While is used to fail if a caller tries to issue another SendAsync while a previous one is running, internally we use SendFrameAsync as an implementation detail, and it should not cause user requests to SendAsync to fail, nor should such internal usage be allowed to run concurrently with other internal usage or with SendAsync.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._state
member.summary: The current state of the web socket in the protocol.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._disposed
member.summary: true if Dispose has been called; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._sentCloseFrame
member.summary: Whether we've ever sent a close frame.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._receivedCloseFrame
member.summary: Whether we've ever received a close frame.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._closeStatus
member.summary: The reason for the close, as sent by the server, or null if not yet closed.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._closeStatusDescription
member.summary: A description of the close reason as sent by the server, or null if not yet closed.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._lastReceiveHeader
member.summary: The last header received in a ReceiveAsync. If ReceiveAsync got a header but then returned fewer bytes than was indicated in the header, subsequent ReceiveAsync calls will use the data from the header to construct the subsequent receive results, and the payload length in this header will be decremented to indicate the number of bytes remaining to be received for that header. As a result, between fragments, the payload length in this header should be 0.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._receiveBufferOffset
member.summary: The offset of the next available byte in the _receiveBuffer.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._receiveBufferCount
member.summary: The number of bytes available in the _receiveBuffer.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._receivedMaskOffsetOffset
member.summary: When dealing with partially read fragments of binary/text messages, a mask previously received may still apply, and the first new byte received may not correspond to the 0th position in the mask. This value is the next offset into the mask that should be applied.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._sendBuffer
member.summary: Temporary send buffer. This should be released back to the ArrayPool once it's no longer needed for the current send operation. It is stored as an instance field to minimize needing to pass it around and to avoid it becoming a field on various async state machine objects.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._lastSendWasFragment
member.summary: Whether the last SendAsync had endOfMessage==false. We need to track this so that we can send the subsequent message with a continuation opcode if the last message was a fragment.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._lastSendAsync
member.summary: The task returned from the last SendAsync operation to not complete synchronously. If this is not null and not completed when a subsequent SendAsync is issued, an exception occurs.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket._lastReceiveAsync
member.summary: The task returned from the last ReceiveAsync operation to not complete synchronously. If this is not null and not completed when a subsequent ReceiveAsync is issued, an exception occurs.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.StateUpdateLock
member.summary: Lock used to protect update and check-and-update operations on _state.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ManagedWebSocket.ReceiveAsyncLock
member.summary: We need to coordinate between receives and close operations happening concurrently, as a ReceiveAsync may be pending while a Close{Output}Async is issued, which itself needs to loop until a close frame is received. As such, we need thread-safety in the management of .

The CancellationToken to use to cancel the websocket.

member.summary: Sends a websocket frame to the network. The caller must hold the sending lock.
member.param: The opcode for the message.
The value of the FIN bit for the message.
The buffer containing the payload data fro the message.

member.summary: Receive the next text, binary, continuation, or close message, returning information about it and writing its payload into the supplied buffer. Other control messages may be consumed and processed as part of this operation, but data about them will not be returned.
member.param: The buffer into which payload data should be written.
The CancellationToken used to cancel the websocket.

member.summary: Processes a received close message.

The cancellation token to use to cancel the websocket.

The cancellation token to use to cancel the websocket.

member.summary: Check whether a close status is valid according to the RFC.
